alert.note: Alert for Christian; Daviess; Henderson; McLean; Muhlenberg; Todd; Trigg (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 2:24AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Wind Gusts of 30 to locally 50 mph possible ahead of line of showers and thunderstorms overnight... Wind gusts of 30 to 45 mph, and possibly as high as 50 to 55 mph, will be possible ahead of the line of showers and thunderstorms that were moving across southeast Missouri and southern Illinois. These higher wind gusts will be generally out of the south and could persist between one to three hours well ahead of the line of showers and thunderstorms. The most likely area expected to be impacted by these stronger winds overnight will be west Kentucky, extreme southeast Illinois, and eastern sections of southwest Indiana. These gusty winds will toss around loose outdoor objects and may cause small tree limbs to break off or topple some trees weakened by the moist ground from heavy rain. Travelers on east and west oriented roadways may also encounter difficulty controlling their vehicles due to the gusty winds. These gusty winds will remain possible through at 4 am CST, ahead of the line of showers and thunderstorms.
